hw2

Class HiddenText

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw2.HiddenText

  • public class HiddenText
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing some hidden text for a letter-guessing game. The displayed text is a character array in which all alphabetic characters are initially replaced by the '*' character. (Spaces and punctuation, if any, are always shown normally. A character ch is considered alphabetic if Character.isAlphabetic(ch) returns true.) Whenever the update() method is called with a letter that actually occurs in the hidden text, that character replaces the '*' character in the hidden text. All methods are case-insensitive and internally, all text and characters are converted to upper-case.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HiddenText(java.lang.String phrase)
      Constructs a GameText using the given string as the hidden text.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int countHiddenConsonants()
      Returns the number of consonant positions that are currently not displayed (are occupied by '*' characters).
      int countHiddenLetters()
      Returns the number of alphabetic character positions that are currently not displayed (occupied by '*' characters).
      char[] getDisplayedText()
      Returns the displayed form of the hidden text, in which only the letters that have been identified by the update() method are revealed.
      java.lang.String getHiddenText()
      Returns the actual hidden text stored in this object.
      int letterCount(char ch)
      Returns the number of times the given character occurs in the hidden text.
      void update(char ch)
      Updates the displayed text to reveal all occurrences of the given character in the hidden text, if any.
      void updateAllRemaining()
      Updates the displayed text to reveal all hidden letters.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HiddenText

        public HiddenText(java.lang.String phrase)
        Constructs a GameText using the given string as the hidden text. The hidden text is assumed NOT to contain the character '*'. Internally the text is converted to upper case.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the given hidden text

    • Method Detail

      • countHiddenConsonants

        public int countHiddenConsonants()
        Returns the number of consonant positions that are currently not displayed (are occupied by '*' characters). A consonant is defined as an alphabetic character other than a vowel (A, E, I, O, or U).
        Returns:
        number of consonant positions not yet identified

      • countHiddenLetters

        public int countHiddenLetters()
        Returns the number of alphabetic character positions that are currently not displayed (occupied by '*' characters).
        Returns:
        number of characters positions not yet identified

      • getDisplayedText

        public char[] getDisplayedText()
        Returns the displayed form of the hidden text, in which only the letters that have been identified by the update() method are revealed.
        Returns:
        displayed form of the hidden text

      • getHiddenText

        public java.lang.String getHiddenText()
        Returns the actual hidden text stored in this object.
        Returns:
        the hidden text

      • letterCount

        public int letterCount(char ch)
        Returns the number of times the given character occurs in the hidden text. Does not modify the displayed text. This method is not case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to check
        Returns:
        number of occurrences of the given character in the hidden text

      • update

        public void update(char ch)
        Updates the displayed text to reveal all occurrences of the given character in the hidden text, if any. Has no effect if the character does not occur in the hidden text. The given character is converted to upper case.
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to be revealed

      • updateAllRemaining

        public void updateAllRemaining()
        Updates the displayed text to reveal all hidden letters.
